title: Tamarind Hall
description: Tamarind Hall Branch Library is located in the rural parish of St. Joseph on the eastern side of the island. Less than two miles from the picturesque Bathsheba Bay, it is situated in the Eric Holder Jr. Municipal Complex at Blackman. This is a perfect place to study with its quiet and serene setting. This is the latest branch to be opened by the National Library Service, and boasts a computer centre with Internet access. This library offers access to EBSCO online database which contains e-books journals, newspapers and magazines, readersâ€™ assistance, exhibitions and displays in addition to its lending, reference and photocopying services. Saturday morning story readings are held at 10:00 a.m. Our regular hours are Monday to Friday 10:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. and 2:00 p.m. to 6:00 p.m., and Saturday 9 a.m. to 1:00 p.m.
